title: How to Block Websites on an iPhone

steps.title: Open your iPhone’s Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone’s Settings. This is an app you’ll find on one of your home screens, represented by a gray cog icon. If you don’t see the icon, check the Utilities folder.

steps.title: Tap General.
steps.content: Tap General . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Restrictions.
steps.content: Tap Restrictions . It’s in the 5th section.

steps.title: Tap Enable Restrictions.
steps.content: Tap Enable Restrictions . If Restrictions are already enabled, you won’t see this button. Instead, you’ll be at a menu titled “Restrictions.” Skip to step 7, and enter your 4-digit passcode when prompted.

steps.title: Type a 4-digit passcode.
steps.content: Type a 4-digit passcode. This is a passcode that you’ll use when you want to make changes to blocked websites on this iPhone. If you lose or forget this passcode, you won’t be able to edit restrictions without erasing the content from your iPhone. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Type the passcode again to confirm.
steps.content: Type the passcode again to confirm.

steps.title: Tap Websites.
steps.content: Tap Websites . It’s at the bottom of the first section. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Add a Website under “Never Allow.”
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Add a Website under “Never Allow.” This is the final option, at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Type the URL of a site you want to block.
steps.content: Type the URL of a site you want to block. Use the format www.sitetoblock.com . Some sites have mobile versions that you’ll need to block separately. For example, Google’s mobile website is accessible at m.google.com .

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . The website you entered is no longer accessible in Safari. To block another website, tap Add a Website again. If you’d like to block all adult/obscene content, scroll back up and tap Limit Adult Content .

steps.title: Open your iPhone’s Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone’s Settings. This is an app you’ll find on one of your home screens, represented by a gray cog icon. If you don’t see the icon, check the Utilities folder. Use this method only if you want to block access to all websites in Safari except those you add. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap General.
steps.content: Tap General .

steps.title: Tap Restrictions.
steps.content: Tap Restrictions . It’s in the 5th section.

steps.title: Tap Enable Restrictions.
steps.content: Tap Enable Restrictions . If Restrictions are already enabled, you won’t see this button. Instead, you’ll be at a menu titled “Restrictions.” Skip to step 7, and enter your 4-digit passcode when prompted.

steps.title: Type a 4-digit passcode.
steps.content: Type a 4-digit passcode. This is a passcode that you’ll use when you want to make changes to blocked websites on this iPhone. If you lose or forget this passcode, you won’t be able to edit restrictions without erasing the content from your iPhone. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Type the passcode again to confirm.
steps.content: Type the passcode again to confirm.

steps.title: Tap Websites.
steps.content: Tap Websites . It’s at the bottom of the “Allowed Content” section. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Specific Websites Only.
steps.content: Tap Specific Websites Only . When this option is active, a blue checkmark will appear to the right of these words.

steps.title: Tap Add a Website… under “Always Allow.”
steps.content: Tap Add a Website… under “Always Allow.”

steps.title: Enter a website’s address.
steps.content: Enter a website’s address. This should be an address you want users of this phone to be able to visit. Use the format www.google.com . Some sites have mobile versions that you’ll need to allow separately. For example, Google’s mobile website is accessible at m.google.com .

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . When you use Safari on this device, you will no longer be able to access sites other than those you added here. To allow more websites, tap Add a Website… under “Always Allow” again.
